security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. All content is instructional documentation describing a 5-phase intent analysis methodology. No scripts, network calls, filesystem modifications, or external command executions are present as actual executables.

content.value_statement: Unclear requests waste time and create frustration. This skill uses cognitive science and probabilistic reasoning to understand what users truly mean, ask clarifying questions, and create actionable plans with confidence scores.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes user requests using probabilistic intent mapping with confidence scores
Breaks complex requests into components using first principles decomposition
Generates clarifying questions to resolve ambiguity through Socratic questioning
Creates actionable execution briefs with phased plans and agent assignments
Adapts questioning complexity based on detected user expertise level
limitations: Requires user participation for clarifying questions
Does not access external systems or APIs
Cannot execute code or modify files
Confidence threshold may require multiple clarification rounds

best_practices: Provide project context like recent files and current working directory
Answer clarifying questions honestly for accurate probability mapping
Review interpretation before confirming to catch misunderstandings early
anti_patterns: Skipping clarification when confidence is below 0.8 threshold
Providing incomplete context that leads to wrong interpretation
Confirming understanding without reviewing the breakdown

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Claude, Codex, and Claude Code all support intent analysis workflows.

faq.question: How long does full analysis take?
faq.answer: Average duration is 15-25 minutes including clarification rounds.

faq.question: Can I integrate with other workflows?
faq.answer: Yes. Output feeds SPARC specification, feature development, and cascade orchestrator.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: All processing is local. No data is sent to external services.

faq.question: What if confidence stays low?
faq.answer: After 3 clarification rounds, request specific examples or suggest user reformulate.

faq.question: How is this different from standard clarification?
faq.answer: Uses probabilistic reasoning, evidence tracking, and cognitive science principles.
